title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A story of wealth, love, and the elusive American Dream, set in the roaring 1920s.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: Elizabeth Bennet navigates issues of manners, morality, and marriage in 19th century England.

author: George Orwell
description: A chilling portrayal of a totalitarian regime and the dangers of absolute political control.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A young girl comes of age in the racially charged Deep South, guided by her father Atticus Finch.
comments: Scout is such a great narrator.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: Bilbo Baggins embarks on an unexpected adventure with a band of dwarves to reclaim their homeland.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: Holden Caulfield recounts his teenage experiences with alienation and loss in 1950s New York.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
description: A young shepherd named Santiago embarks on a journey to fulfill his personal legend.

title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
author: J.K. Rowling
description: A young boy discovers heâ€™s a wizard and begins his adventures at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.

title: The Fault in Our Stars
author: John Green
description: Two teenagers with cancer fall in love and search for meaning together.

title: Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind
author: Yuval Noah Harari
description: A sweeping history of human evolution, culture, and progress from ancient times to the modern age.
